column1: 4133004000,17457,Deep venous thrombosis referent incident cohort,"Persons with condition occurrence of referent concept (4133004) or descendants, for the first time in the person's history. Persons exit cohort at the end of the observation period.",4133004001,4133004,referent,,"{

column3: Deep venous thrombosis referent incident cohort""
[PL 4133004001] Deep venous thrombosis referent concept incident cohort: First occurrence of referent concept + descendants with >=365d prior observation""
Persons with condition occurrence of referent concept (4133004) or descendants, for the first time in the person's history. Persons exit cohort at the end of the observation period.""

column1: SELECT 0 as codeset_id, c.concept_id FROM (select distinct I.concept_id FROM
select concept_id from @vocabulary_database_schema.CONCEPT where concept_id in (4133004)
with primary_events (event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, visit_occurrence_id) as
select P.ordinal as event_id, P.person_id, P.start_date, P.end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, cast(P.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY E.person_id ORDER BY E.sort_date ASC) ordinal,
OP.observation_period_start_date as op_start_date, OP.observation_period_end_date as op_end_date, cast(E.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
SELECT C.person_id, C.condition_occurrence_id as event_id, C.condition_start_date as start_date, COALESCE(C.condition_end_date, DATEADD(day,1,C.condition_start_date)) as end_date,
SELECT co.* , row_number() over (PARTITION BY co.person_id ORDER BY co.condition_start_date, co.condition_occurrence_id) as ordinal
JOIN #Codesets codesets on ((co.condition_concept_id = codesets.concept_id and codesets.codeset_id = 0))

column2: JOIN @cdm_database_schema.observation_period OP on E.person_id = OP.person_id and E.start_date >=  OP.observation_period_start_date and E.start_date <= op.observation_period_end_date

column1: SELECT event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, visit_occurrence_id

select pe.event_id, pe.person_id, pe.start_date, pe.end_date, pe.op_start_date, pe.op_end_date, row_number() over (partition by pe.person_id order by pe.start_date ASC) as ordinal, cast(pe.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
with cteIncludedEvents(event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, ordinal) as
SELECT event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, row_number() over (partition by person_id order by start_date ASC) as ordinal
select Q.event_id, Q.person_id, Q.start_date, Q.end_date, Q.op_start_date, Q.op_end_date, SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on I.person_id = Q.person_id and I.event_id = Q.event_id
GROUP BY Q.event_id, Q.person_id, Q.start_date, Q.end_date, Q.op_start_date, Q.op_end_date
select event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date
-- By default, cohort exit at the event's op end date
select event_id, person_id, op_end_date as end_date from #included_events

column2: select I.event_id, I.person_id, I.start_date, E.end_date, row_number() over (partition by I.person_id, I.event_id order by E.end_date) as ordinal
join cohort_ends E on I.event_id = E.event_id and I.person_id = E.person_id and E.end_date >= I.start_date

column1: with cteEndDates (person_id, end_date) AS -- the magic

column4: , MAX(start_ordinal) OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY event_date, event_type ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING) AS start_ordinal
, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY event_date, event_type) AS overall_ord

column5: , ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY start_date) AS start_ordinal

column2: JOIN cteEndDates e ON c.person_id = e.person_id AND e.end_date >= c.start_date

column1: select person_id, min(start_date) as start_date, end_date
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, person_id, start_date, end_date
-- Find the event that is the 'best match' per person.
-- the 'best match' is defined as the event that satisfies the most inclusion rules.
-- ties are solved by choosing the event that matches the earliest inclusion rule, and then earliest.

column2: SELECT R.person_id, R.event_id, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY R.person_id ORDER BY R.rule_count DESC,R.min_rule_id ASC, R.start_date ASC) AS rank_value

column3: SELECT Q.person_id, Q.event_id, COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT I.inclusion_rule_id), 0) AS rule_count, COALESCE(MIN(I.inclusion_rule_id), 0) AS min_rule_id, Q.start_date
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I ON q.person_id = i.person_id AND q.event_id = i.event_id

column1: ) ranked on Q.person_id = ranked.person_id and Q.event_id = ranked.event_id
-- modes of generation: (the same tables store the results for the different modes, identified by the mode_id column)
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, inclusion_rule_mask, count_big(*) as person_count, 0 as mode_id
select Q.person_id, Q.event_id, CAST(SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) AS bigint) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on q.person_id = i.person_id and q.event_id = i.event_id
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
insert into @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats (cohort_definition_id, rule_sequence, person_count, gain_count, person_total, mode_id)
select ir.cohort_definition_id, ir.rule_sequence, coalesce(T.person_count, 0) as person_count, coalesce(SR.person_count, 0) gain_count, EventTotal.total, 0 as mode_id
JOIN #inclusion_events i on Q.person_id = I.person_id and Q.event_id = i.event_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
CROSS JOIN (select count_big(event_id) as total from #qualified_events) EventTotal

LEFT JOIN @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result SR on SR.mode_id = 0 AND SR.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id AND (POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules) - POWER(cast(2 as bigint),ir.rule_sequence) - 1) = SR.inclusion_rule_mask -- POWER(2,rule count) - POWER(2,rule sequence) - 1 is the mask for 'all except this rule'
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_summary_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, PC.total as person_count, coalesce(FC.total, 0) as final_count, 0 as mode_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
where sr.mode_id = 0 and sr.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and sr.inclusion_rule_mask = POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules)-1
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, inclusion_rule_mask, count_big(*) as person_count, 1 as mode_id
select Q.person_id, Q.event_id, CAST(SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) AS bigint) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on q.person_id = i.person_id and q.event_id = i.event_id
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
insert into @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats (cohort_definition_id, rule_sequence, person_count, gain_count, person_total, mode_id)
select ir.cohort_definition_id, ir.rule_sequence, coalesce(T.person_count, 0) as person_count, coalesce(SR.person_count, 0) gain_count, EventTotal.total, 1 as mode_id
JOIN #inclusion_events i on Q.person_id = I.person_id and Q.event_id = i.event_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
CROSS JOIN (select count_big(event_id) as total from #best_events) EventTotal

LEFT JOIN @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result SR on SR.mode_id = 1 AND SR.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id AND (POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules) - POWER(cast(2 as bigint),ir.rule_sequence) - 1) = SR.inclusion_rule_mask -- POWER(2,rule count) - POWER(2,rule sequence) - 1 is the mask for 'all except this rule'
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_summary_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, PC.total as person_count, coalesce(FC.total, 0) as final_count, 1 as mode_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
where sr.mode_id = 1 and sr.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and sr.inclusion_rule_mask = POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules)-1

with primary_events (event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, visit_occurrence_id) as
select P.ordinal as event_id, P.person_id, P.start_date, P.end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, cast(P.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY E.person_id ORDER BY E.sort_date ASC) ordinal,
OP.observation_period_start_date as op_start_date, OP.observation_period_end_date as op_end_date, cast(E.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
SELECT C.person_id, C.condition_occurrence_id as event_id, C.condition_start_date as start_date, COALESCE(C.condition_end_date, DATEADD(day,1,C.condition_start_date)) as end_date,
JOIN #Codesets codesets on ((co.condition_concept_id = codesets.concept_id and codesets.codeset_id = 0))

column2: JOIN @cdm_database_schema.observation_period OP on E.person_id = OP.person_id and E.start_date >=  OP.observation_period_start_date and E.start_date <= op.observation_period_end_date

column1: SELECT event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, visit_occurrence_id

select pe.event_id, pe.person_id, pe.start_date, pe.end_date, pe.op_start_date, pe.op_end_date, row_number() over (partition by pe.person_id order by pe.start_date ASC) as ordinal, cast(pe.visit_occurrence_id as bigint) as visit_occurrence_id
with cteIncludedEvents(event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, ordinal) as
SELECT event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date, row_number() over (partition by person_id order by start_date ASC) as ordinal
select Q.event_id, Q.person_id, Q.start_date, Q.end_date, Q.op_start_date, Q.op_end_date, SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on I.person_id = Q.person_id and I.event_id = Q.event_id
GROUP BY Q.event_id, Q.person_id, Q.start_date, Q.end_date, Q.op_start_date, Q.op_end_date
select event_id, person_id, start_date, end_date, op_start_date, op_end_date
case when DATEADD(day,365,start_date) > op_end_date then op_end_date else DATEADD(day,365,start_date) end as end_date

column2: select I.event_id, I.person_id, I.start_date, E.end_date, row_number() over (partition by I.person_id, I.event_id order by E.end_date) as ordinal
join cohort_ends E on I.event_id = E.event_id and I.person_id = E.person_id and E.end_date >= I.start_date

column1: with cteEndDates (person_id, end_date) AS -- the magic

column4: , MAX(start_ordinal) OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY event_date, event_type ROWS UNBOUNDED PRECEDING) AS start_ordinal
, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY event_date, event_type) AS overall_ord

column5: , ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY person_id ORDER BY start_date) AS start_ordinal

column2: JOIN cteEndDates e ON c.person_id = e.person_id AND e.end_date >= c.start_date

column1: select person_id, min(start_date) as start_date, end_date
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, person_id, start_date, end_date
-- Find the event that is the 'best match' per person.
-- the 'best match' is defined as the event that satisfies the most inclusion rules.
-- ties are solved by choosing the event that matches the earliest inclusion rule, and then earliest.

column2: SELECT R.person_id, R.event_id, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY R.person_id ORDER BY R.rule_count DESC,R.min_rule_id ASC, R.start_date ASC) AS rank_value

column3: SELECT Q.person_id, Q.event_id, COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT I.inclusion_rule_id), 0) AS rule_count, COALESCE(MIN(I.inclusion_rule_id), 0) AS min_rule_id, Q.start_date
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I ON q.person_id = i.person_id AND q.event_id = i.event_id

column1: ) ranked on Q.person_id = ranked.person_id and Q.event_id = ranked.event_id
-- modes of generation: (the same tables store the results for the different modes, identified by the mode_id column)
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, inclusion_rule_mask, count_big(*) as person_count, 0 as mode_id
select Q.person_id, Q.event_id, CAST(SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) AS bigint) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on q.person_id = i.person_id and q.event_id = i.event_id
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
insert into @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats (cohort_definition_id, rule_sequence, person_count, gain_count, person_total, mode_id)
select ir.cohort_definition_id, ir.rule_sequence, coalesce(T.person_count, 0) as person_count, coalesce(SR.person_count, 0) gain_count, EventTotal.total, 0 as mode_id
JOIN #inclusion_events i on Q.person_id = I.person_id and Q.event_id = i.event_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
CROSS JOIN (select count_big(event_id) as total from #qualified_events) EventTotal

LEFT JOIN @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result SR on SR.mode_id = 0 AND SR.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id AND (POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules) - POWER(cast(2 as bigint),ir.rule_sequence) - 1) = SR.inclusion_rule_mask -- POWER(2,rule count) - POWER(2,rule sequence) - 1 is the mask for 'all except this rule'
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_summary_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 0;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, PC.total as person_count, coalesce(FC.total, 0) as final_count, 0 as mode_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
where sr.mode_id = 0 and sr.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and sr.inclusion_rule_mask = POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules)-1
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, inclusion_rule_mask, count_big(*) as person_count, 1 as mode_id
select Q.person_id, Q.event_id, CAST(SUM(coalesce(POWER(cast(2 as bigint), I.inclusion_rule_id), 0)) AS bigint) as inclusion_rule_mask
LEFT JOIN #inclusion_events I on q.person_id = i.person_id and q.event_id = i.event_id
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
insert into @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_stats (cohort_definition_id, rule_sequence, person_count, gain_count, person_total, mode_id)
select ir.cohort_definition_id, ir.rule_sequence, coalesce(T.person_count, 0) as person_count, coalesce(SR.person_count, 0) gain_count, EventTotal.total, 1 as mode_id
JOIN #inclusion_events i on Q.person_id = I.person_id and Q.event_id = i.event_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
CROSS JOIN (select count_big(event_id) as total from #best_events) EventTotal

LEFT JOIN @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion_result SR on SR.mode_id = 1 AND SR.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id AND (POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules) - POWER(cast(2 as bigint),ir.rule_sequence) - 1) = SR.inclusion_rule_mask -- POWER(2,rule count) - POWER(2,rule sequence) - 1 is the mask for 'all except this rule'
delete from @results_database_schema.cohort_summary_stats where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and mode_id = 1;
select @target_cohort_id as cohort_definition_id, PC.total as person_count, coalesce(FC.total, 0) as final_count, 1 as mode_id
CROSS JOIN (select count(*) as total_rules from @results_database_schema.cohort_inclusion where cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id) RuleTotal
where sr.mode_id = 1 and sr.cohort_definition_id = @target_cohort_id and sr.inclusion_rule_mask = POWER(cast(2 as bigint),RuleTotal.total_rules)-1
